discussion.content: It provides the server's identity information to connecting SSH clients.

choices.A: It must be sent by any SSH client in addition to a user key in order to identify the client's host.
choices.E: It is used by system services like cron, syslog or a backup job to automatically connect to remote hosts.
choices.B: It provides the server's identity information to connecting SSH clients.
choices.D: It authenticates any user that logs into a remote machine from the key's host.
choices.C: It is the root key by which all user SSH keys must be signed.

questions.question_text: What is a purpose of an SSH host key?

discussion.content: On a Linux system with shadow passwords enabled, the password hashes of all local users are stored in the file "/etc/shadow".

questions.question_text:
FILL BLANK -
On a Linux system with shadow passwords enabled, which file in the file system contains the password hashes of all local users? (Specify the full name of the file, including path.)
Which of the following commands connects to the remote host example.com which has OpenSSH listening on TCP port 2222? (Choose TWO correct answers.)

discussion.content:
A. ssh --port 2222 example.com
B. ssh -p 2222 example.com

questions.question_text: Which of the following SQL queries counts the number of occurrences for each value of the field order_type in the table orders?

choices.B: SELECT order_type,COUNT(*) FROM orders GROUP BY order_type;
choices.E: SELECT AUTO_COUNT FROM orders COUNT order_type;
choices.A: SELECT order_type,COUNT(*) FROM orders WHERE order_type=order_type;
choices.D: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM orders ORDER BY order_type;
